image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: An audit has revealed an Adelaide aged care facility was inappropriately using restraints on patients, raising the question of whether the state government has learned from the Oakden aged care scandal in 2017.

title.children: Has the SA government learned from the Oakden aged care scandal?

image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: An expert in artificial intelligence says a fake image depicting missing four-year-old Gus being abducted in South Australia's outback highlights the dangerous link between AI and the spread of misinformation.

title.children: Expert says AI-generated image of missing boy Gus case raises serious concerns

image.altText: Transmission towers lining up in Burra

props.synopsis: Touted as a model for the energy transition, a "quick and easy" high-voltage powerline project linking South Australia directly to New South Wales is running dramatically over time and over budget.

title.children: Australia's energy transition in flux as major power arteries struggle to get built

image.altText: Dead marine life at Adelaide's West Beach.

props.synopsis: The SA government has never formally requested that the Commonwealth declare the algal bloom a "national disaster", a senior bureaucrat has told a parliamentary inquiry — despite a state minister "advocating" for such a response three months ago.

title.children: Algal 'disaster' request never formally made, bloom chief tells inquiry

image.altText: A man stares into the lens

props.synopsis: A Kangaroo Island brewer says he will no longer supply beer to the island's ferry service, amid a growing outcry over the high cost of fares to the popular international tourism destination.

title.children: Brewer stages beer boycott over Kangaroo Island ferry's 'ridiculous' fares

image.altText: A plane on the runway with people standing around

props.synopsis: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.

title.children: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport

image.altText: Shaun de Bruyn stands in a grassed area wearing a white shirt and navy suit

props.synopsis: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

title.children: Tourism operators facing 'dire straits' without more algal bloom relief

image.altText: Ligurian bees on Kangaroo Island.

props.synopsis: A deadly parasite that has laid waste to bee colonies throughout Australia has so far not made it to Kangaroo Island, home to the world's oldest bee sanctuary.

title.children: Scramble to protect world's oldest bee colony from parasitic killer

image.altText: A headshot of Taylor Swift with jewels and feathers surrounding her head

props.synopsis: Founder and designer Paul Vasileff says he's grateful to have his Adelaide-made couture dress on the world stage with pop superstar Taylor Swift wearing it in the new The Fate of Ophelia music video.

title.children: Taylor Swift shines in Australian-designed dress in lead single

image.altText: a person using a mobile phone

props.synopsis: The High Court has ruled on the use of information gathered through the AN0M app, which was developed by the Australian Federal Police for surveillance.

title.children: High Court endorses use of encrypted phone app to monitor crime figures

image.altText: A couple of people riding waves on surfboards.

props.synopsis: A surfer who was twice bitten by a shark that was reportedly chasing a seal in waters off Kangaroo Island, is recovering well with a coffee, according to his boss.

title.children: Surfer bitten twice by shark, recovering well with 'flat white'

image.altText: Bella Kolinac stands with her bike helmet on on an outback road.

props.synopsis: Broken Hill nurse Bella Kolinac, 23, will represent Australia at the Ironman World Championship — Women in Kona, Hawaii.

title.children: Outback athlete shares journey to ironman world championship

image.altText: A building with grey, green and brown colouring and the words 'Edge Early Learning'

props.synopsis: The Education Standards Board has closed Edge Early Learning Centre at Plympton for 90 days following an investigation into reports of "inadequate supervision" of children.

title.children: SA childcare centre 'unsuitable to open' amid supervision concerns

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: Police say they have conducted a "significant" aerial search of a property in South Australia's mid-north, where a four-year-old boy went missing 10 days ago.

title.children: Results of drone searches for 4yo Gus on SA property 'being analysed'

image.altText: A male police officer looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: South Australia's corruption watchdog has cleared Police Commissioner Grant Stevens of a discipline breach for accidentally discharging his firearm during a house raid in the early 1990s.

title.children: SA Police Commissioner cleared over 1990s firearm incident

image.altText: A bunch of healthy looking tomatoes on a vine.

props.synopsis: More than a year since South Australia's $230 million tomato and capsicum sector was plunged into turmoil by the first discovery of the tomato brown rugose fruit virus in Australia, the state has been declared free of the exotic disease.

title.children: Relief for fruit producers as SA declared free from brown rugose virus

image.altText: A vast waterway from above

props.synopsis: The floodwaters that have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

title.children: Floodwaters 'transform whole desert' as Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre reaches peak

image.altText: A white sign with two logos and writing on it with a road, a blue sky and bushland behind it.

props.synopsis: The corporation has been fined $2,000 for failing to lodge reports to the Office of the Registrar of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Corporations.

title.children: Indigenous-run corporation convicted, fined for failing to lodge reports

image.altText: A smaller Kangaroo stands in front of a larger kangaroo in high grass.

props.synopsis: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

title.children: Kangaroos add pressure on drought-hit farmers by eating scarce feed

image.altText: A baby in a white top with cartoon animals on it lies on a rug on the floor with her fist against her mouth.

props.synopsis: The death of a 15-week-old baby in an unlicensed home daycare in Victoria’s north-east is among more than two dozen disturbing childcare incidents recorded in government documents unearthed by the ABC.

title.children: Fears baby's death in illegal childcare centre is 'tip of the iceberg'

image.altText: A woman wearing black standing in the doorway opening of a tent.

props.synopsis: The war in Gaza may be ending soon, but those displaced by Israel's bombardment and invasion know their suffering is far from over.

title.children: After eight moves, Majeda is exhausted. This is her story of displacement in Gaza

image.altText: A green long narco sub

props.synopsis: Cousins Reubenson and Martin Fugui found a 'Made in Colombia' narco sub in Solomon Islands over the weekend — the third such vessel found in the country's waters over the past year.

title.children: 'Made in Colombia' narco sub found floating in Solomon Islands

image.altText: A large white and yellow ship with cranes and lifeboats on the side.

props.synopsis: Two years after the RSV Nuyina was banned from going under Hobart's Tasman Bridge to refuel, the Australian Antarctic Division has formally ditched the possibility of trying to overturn the decision.

title.children: Icebreaker's costly bridge ban won't be reassessed

image.altText: An aerial shot of white roofed houses.

props.synopsis: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

title.children: Rental prices stabilise but remain at 'record highs', report shows

image.altText: Tight shot of a man seated at a microphone speaking.

props.synopsis: The guilty plea follows an extraordinary chain of events that saw Mr Trump publicly implore Attorney General Pam Bondi to take action against Mr Comey and other perceived adversaries.

title.children: Former FBI director James Comey pleads not guilty in Congress case

image.altText: Kerry Forrest standing on the street.

props.synopsis: In the three years that 65-year-old Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

title.children: 'I'm 65 that's what's different': Kerry has never had trouble finding work, until now

image.altText: A man with shoulder-length brown hair and beard looks neutrally at the camera

props.synopsis: Police arrested and charged Jonathan Rinderknecht over the fire this week, which was the most destructive in Los Angeles's history.

title.children: Man charged over Los Angeles Pacific Palisades fire that killed 12 people

image.altText: A man works in a furnace wearing protective equipment.

props.synopsis: The industry minister has defended a $600 million joint bailout of a Queensland copper smelter as "a good use of public resources". Follow live.

title.children: Minister defends $600m bailout of copper smelter as 'good use of public resources'

image.altText: SNAICC CEO and Indigenous Commissioners

props.synopsis: Governments have been unable to reduce the rates of First Nations children in out-of-care and youth detention. Advocates say the new children's commissioner needs the power to hold them to account.

title.children: 'Listen and learn': Calls for First Nations commissioner to be given 'teeth'

image.altText: Man lying face down on the road, handcuffed behind his back next to a car with the door open. He's surrounded by police and cars

props.synopsis: It is a tried and true tactic in the underworld when trying to get away with murder, but police have sought out "kill cars" and they are reaping the rewards from it.

title.children: Police turn attention to use of 'kill cars' in attempted underworld hits

image.altText: A person at the beach applying sunblock to their arm.

props.synopsis: Summer is just around the corner, and many Australians are confused right now about which sunscreens they can trust.

title.children: Summer is approaching and Australians are confused about their sunscreens

image.altText: A man works in a furnace wearing protective equipment.

props.synopsis: The bailout of another metals facility — this time in Queensland — is unlikely to be the last, with pressures on the sector driven by China to keep up for years.

title.children: The unspoken reason why the metals industry is being bailed out

image.altText: A close up of Hugh Marks grimacing

props.synopsis: A Federal Court judge found the ABC breached the Fair Work Act when it removed the journalist and broadcaster from the air during a five-day radio presenting contract.

title.children: ABC spent more than $2.5m defending legal action from Antoinette Lattouf
